definition: surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: When we mentioned Mr. Chern, he responded immediately, "Mr."
sentences.chinese: 我們跟他說起陳先生，他立馬接過話說，陳省身？

sentences.english: As the founder of the Nankai Institute of Mathematics, S.
sentences.chinese: 陳省身，南開數學研究所創始人。
